MetaData.MetaDataItem: Yale Real Living® Assure Lock™ Interconnect combines electronic deadbolts with the convenience of a passage lever for panic proof egress. From the inside, both the latchbolt and the deadbolt are retracted simultaneously in a single motion for a quick and easy exit. Ships with Z-Wave Plus Smart Module.
Yale Real Living® Assure Lock™ Interconnected Z-Wave Enabled Push Button Deadbolt

ChangeLog.Entry: Initial Metadata Import from Z-Wave Alliance Database - https://products.z-wavealliance.org/products/687/xml

MetaData.MetaDataItem: Enter the 4-8 master Pin code followed by the gear key. Press the 7 key followed by the gear key Press the 1 key followed by the gear key

Remove the battery cover and batteries. Remove the interior escutcheon to access the reset button. The reset button is located above the PCB cable connector. While pressing the reset button for a minimum of 3 seconds, reinstall batteries. Release reset button. Replace battery cover. Please use this procedure only when the network primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable
Enter the 4-8 digit master pin code followed by the gear key Press the 7 key followed by the gear key Press the 3 key followed by the gear key

Value.label: Audio Mode
Value.Help: Disable the door sensor alarm function.

Value.label: Re-lock Time
Value.Help: seconds; after successful code entry and unit unlocks, it will automatically re-lock after specified time (30 = default value)

Value.label: Wrong Code Entry Limit
Value.Help: The number of invalid code entries lock will accept before sending TAMPER Alarm. When number of wrong code entries is exceeded, lock will disable keypad for the time specified by Shutdown Time parameter. (5 = default)

Value.label: Language
Value.Help: The number of invalid code entries lock will accept before sending TAMPER Alarm. When number of wrong code entries is exceeded, lock will disable keypad for the time specified by Shutdown Time parameter. (5 = default)

Value.label: Shutdown Time
Value.Help: number of seconds unit will be inoperable after number of wrong code entries is exceeded (30 = default)

Value.label: Operating Mode
Value.Help: The number of invalid code entries lock will accept before sending TAMPER Alarm. When number of wrong code entries is exceeded, lock will disable keypad for the time specified by Shutdown Time parameter. (5 = default)
